General.preQuizText:
Check your understanding of Academic integrity warnings.

Select the best answer for the following questions. To begin, select Start Activity.

Questions.questionText: A student left her computer unattended, allowing another student to copy the material and use it as his own. This is an example of:

answers.answerText: Loaned Work to Someone Else / Did not Maintain Security of Work
answers.feedBack: That is correct! This type of Academic Warning / Offence occurs when a student shares material for an individual assignment with another student(s), even if they do not realize that sharing was not allowed. Students and faculty are responsible for maintaining security of their work. While the student that copied the work was also in the wrong, this student is also responsible for the allowing the incident to occur. She should not have left her computer unattended.

Questions.questionText: A student submitted an assignment using in-text citation and a reference. However, the student did not include quotation marks around one short word-for-word quotation. The student cited and referenced the source. This is an example of:

answers.answerText: Citing or Referencing Errors or Omissions
answers.feedBack: That is correct! Citing or Referencing Errors occur when students make minor errors in citation or referencing conventions in an assignment that otherwise shows substantial original work. All material used in an assignment or project must be properly cited and referenced. Providing citation and referencing shows respect to the authors that you borrowed ideas from. It is also showing honesty by letting your instructor know that someone else came up with the idea.
